name: Brazilian Elodea

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: bright to dark green, blade shaped (1-3cm long, up to 5mm wide) in whorls of >3, very finely serrated margins
Flowers: late spring to early fall, small white, 3 petalled flower with yellow center, emerge just above or at surface of water on slender stalks from leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: only produced in native range
Other: most of biomass produced near water surface
Biology: Seed production only in native range - only male flowers present on plants in US
Range: Northeast US Range: New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Vermont, New York

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
